questions.question: Which motor is commonly used for precise control of angular position in Arduino projects?

explanations.a: DC Motors are not suitable for precise angular control but for continuous rotation.
explanations.b: Servo motors are designed for precise control of angular position and are commonly used in Arduino projects.
explanations.c: Stepper motors provide precise control of steps but are typically used for discrete rotations.
explanations.d: Brushless DC motors are more efficient but require more complex control mechanisms.

questions.question: Which motor requires a motor driver like L298N for controlling direction and speed in an Arduino project?

explanations.a: DC motors require a motor driver like L298N to control direction and speed using PWM.
explanations.b: Servo motors do not require a motor driver but are controlled by PWM signals.
explanations.c: Stepper motors often require a driver like ULN2003 or A4988 for controlling steps and direction.
explanations.d: Not all of these motors require a motor driver like L298N. Servo motors don't require one.

questions.question: What is the primary advantage of using a stepper motor in Arduino projects?

answers.a: Stepper motors are faster than DC motors.
answers.b: Stepper motors provide precise control over rotation angle.
answers.c: Stepper motors are cheaper than DC motors.
answers.d: Stepper motors require less power than DC motors.

explanations.a: Stepper motors are not necessarily faster but are precise in their rotations.
explanations.b: The primary advantage of stepper motors is their ability to provide precise control over rotation angle without feedback systems.
explanations.c: Stepper motors are generally more expensive than DC motors due to their precision.
explanations.d: Stepper motors tend to consume more power than DC motors due to their stepwise operation.

questions.question: In Arduino, how is the direction of a DC motor typically controlled?

answers.a: By controlling the PWM signal on the motor pin.
answers.b: By switching the motor's power supply.
answers.c: By using an H-Bridge or motor driver like L298N.

explanations.a: PWM controls the speed of the motor, not the direction.
explanations.b: Switching the power supply does not reliably control the direction of the motor.
explanations.c: The direction of a DC motor is controlled by switching pins on an H-Bridge or using a motor driver like L298N.
explanations.d: Servo motors are used for angular positioning, not for controlling DC motor direction.
